text:
Welcome to How To Cook That, I'm Ann Reardon
and you asked for it so today we are making

10 Best Peanut Butter Recipes in 10 minutes
- let me know what 10 best you'd like to see
next.

And let's see if we can get this video to
15,000 likes

Firstly we have 4 ingredient choc-chip peanut
butter cookies.

For this you'll need peanut butter, sugar,
one egg and some roughly chopped chocolate.

I'll put all of the recipe quantities for
these on the howtocookthat.net website and
i'll link to that below.

Place the peanut butter, sugar and egg into
a bowl and mix it together until it is smooth.

Add about 3/4 of the chocolate and mix it
through.

Now place ice-cream scoops of cookie dough
onto a tray leaving some space between them.

Then using your hand flatten each one and
add the extra chocolate chips on top so that

each one looks like it has a generous amount
in it.

Bake those in the oven until they just start
to brown on the edges, and they will be soft

when you first take them out of the oven but
as they cool they will crisp up.
Next we have peanut butter cheesecake bites.

For the inside of these you'll need cream
cheese, peanut butter and icing sugar.

Mix those together on high speed until it
is smooth and well combined.

Then tip it into a square container - if you
are making more of this, if you are doubling

this, then I suggest you still split it into
containers about this size so it makes it
easier to cut.

Flatten out the top and then use a knife to
mark 9 squares, you are to cutting it just
indenting the top as a bit of a guide.
Now poke in a popsicle stick into each one.

Then put that in the freezer for a couple
of hours.

Once it is frozen, pull it out of the container
and cut along the guidelines that we drew
to make the 9 portions.

Then dip each one in melted chocolate lift
it up and tap your hand to let the excess
drip off.

Then before it sets quickly dip it onto decoration
of your choice and place on baking paper to
set.

I'm just using some sprinkles, some peanuts
and some chocolate sprinkles here.
Number 3 we have peanut butter cups.

Take some mini cupcake cakes and put some
chocolate into each one.
Use a teaspoon to push it up the sides.

You can use compound chocolate for this or
if you use real chocolate with cocoa butter
in it make sure you temper it.

For the filling mix together some warm peanut
butter with icing sugar and keep mixing it

until it comes together and forms a ball like
this.

Add 2 teaspoons of mixture to each chocolate
case and press it down.

Then top each one with chocolate, tap it on
your hand to smooth it out and then leave
those to set.

Once they are set peel off the cupcake case
and you have a peanut butter cup.
Yum look at that peanut butter in the middle.
Now for 2 ingredient Peanut Butter Fudge.

All you will need for this is some peanut
butter and some chocolate.

I'm going to use some dark chocolate and some
white.

Add the chocolate to the peanut butter and
melt it in the microwave for 30 seconds.

Stir it really well to evenly distribute the
heat.

Then microwave for another 20 seconds and
stir again until all the chocolate is melted.

Pour one of them into a tray and spread it
out right to the corners.

Then pour the other one over the top and use
a fork to scoop down to the bottom and fold

it over so you get like a marbled effect right
through the fudge.

Now this is of course is not technically fudge
but it is a similar texture.
Then put that in the fridge to set.

Once it's firm just slice it into squares,
now this is quite rich so don't make them
too big.

At number 5 we have peanut butter and jelly
twist.

For this you'll need bread dough that has
risen once I'll put the recipe for that on

howtocookthat.net website, you'll need peanut
butter and jam or jelly.

Roll one half of the dough into a large rectangle
to about this thickness.

And then spread a thin layer of jam across
the dough.

Roll out the second half of the dough and
place it over the top then peel off the baking
paper.

Spread out the peanut butter evenly over the
top.

Starting at one side roll up the bread dough,
you can use the baking paper to help you roll
it all the way up.

Take a sharp knife and cut it down the center
revealing all those layers.

Join one end together then twist the dough
around keeping the cut edge facing up so we
can see those layers.
Keep twisting it all the way to the end.

Then slide that onto a baking tray and you
want to leave it in a warm place to rise.

Once it has risen and it looks like this,
bake it in an oven until it is golden and
delicious.

For the peanut butter frozen yoghurt you will
need yoghurt, icing sugar, peanut butter and
cream.

Place the yoghurt cream and icing sugar into
an ice cream machine and churn until it is
frozen and thickened.

Warm the peanut butter and pour it onto the
frozen yoghurt and fold that through.

We don't want to mix it in we just want streaks
of peanut butter right through it.

Serve scoop-fuls topped with sliced strawberries
and peanuts... yummm.
Now for this super easy refrigerator cake.

You will need cream, icing sugar, peanut butter
and chocolate cookies or biscuits and we'll

also need some more cream and icing sugar
later.

Put the peanut butter ... cream ... and icing
sugar into a bowl and whisk with electric
beaters until you have stiff peaks like this.

Take one of your cookies and sandwich it to
the next one using your peanut butter cream,

take another put cream on it and add it to
the first ones, continue to add more cookies
until you have three rows.

Take your extra cream and icing sugar and
put it into a bowl with some vanilla and whip
that to firm peaks too.

Use that to cover the whole outside of the
dessert.
Then decorate it how you like.

I am adding sprinkles all over the top to
make it colourful.

Place that in the fridge for about an hour
for the cookies to soften.
Then cut slices across to reveal those layers.

At number 8 we have peanut butter pretzel
bites.

For this we need icing sugar, brown sugar,
crunchy peanut butter, pretzels and chocolate
to coat.

Add the butter icing sugar.. and peanut butter
to the brown sugar and mix that together using
electric beaters until it comes together.

Take a tablespoon of mixture and roll it into
a ball and then sandwich that together between
two pretzels.

Dip one half into tempered chocolate and then
place that onto baking paper to set.

These have quite an intense peanut butter
flavor, a bit like the peanut butter cups,

so if you wanted a little less you could decrease
the peanut butter and increase the other ingredients
there.

At number 9 we have super easy peanut butter
cupcakes.

For this you'll need 1 packet of vanilla cake
mix, some warmed peanut butter and some water.
That's it.

Add the water and the peanut butter to the
cake mix and mix on high speed until it is
smooth and it's airy.

Place scoopfuls into each cupcake case and
bake in the oven for around ten minutes or

until they spring back when you lightly press
them.

Once they're cooled, dip each cupcake in icing
and decorate them how you like, I've put sprinkles

on some and buttercream flowers on others
- there's a video on the howtocookthat channel
that shows you how to make these flowers.

And that give you a moist peanut flavoured
cake.

And next, my favorite - banana peanut butter
mousse

To make this you will need sugar, gelatin,
peanut butter

and cream for the first part of the mousse,
more cream to add to the mousse, cream for
topping and cream and chocolate ganache.

Firstly add two tablespoons of cream to the
gelatin and mix that through so the gelatin
can absorb the liquid.

Now place the sugar, cream and peanut butter
into a bowl and stir them together.

And then heat that in the microwave to melt
the peanut butter and dissolve the sugar.

Add the gelatin and stir that until it is
melted, and you will see the peanut butter
still seems a bit seperate in the mixture.

Don't worry the gelatin will help make these
combine together.

Just take a whisk and give it a good mix,
then leave that to cool at room temperature.

Add the smaller amount of cream to the chocolate
and heat for 30 seconds in the microwave and
then stir until smooth.

Once your peanut mixture is cooled to room
temperature, whip the next bowl of cream to
soft peaks.

And then gently fold it through the peanut
mixture

In a glass place 1 tablespoon of ganache down
the bottom, give it a little shake to smooth
it.

And then top it with 1/2 cup of your peanut
mousse.
Place that in the fridge to set.

And then whip the remaining cream to soft
peaks and take a banana and slice it into
some orange juice.

The orange juice just stops the banana from
going brown, you could use lemon juice too,
whatever you prefer.

Arrange slices of the banana on top of the
mousse and then top that with the whipped

cream and, if you like, add a few peanuts
on top.

chocolate and desserts.

Make it a great week and I'll see you Friday.
